pr_title: Hive profile names now split "protocol" and "format"

timeline.bodyText:
looks like this replaces the Hive profile name with hive, and adds new hive:xxx profiles for the others?  will the user still be able to use Hive?
are we going to want to deprecate the old Hive* profile names in 6.0.0?
timeline.author: lisakowen

replies.bodyText: This PR preserves the old names. The old names are cheap in terms of memory footprint, but we should at some point remove them.
replies.author: frankgh

replies.bodyText: Let's make them case-insensitive in the code and lower-cases in documentation / this file. This will apply to Hive, Jdbc, HBase, etc. The old one-word capitalized names will still work, but will be effectively deprecated. Composite ones like HiveORC will be deprecated, meaning they will still work for now, but will not be documented.
replies.author: denalex

replies.bodyText: @denalex's comment make sense and I agree. A follow-up question -- should we log some of kind of warning/notice in addition to marking it deprecated in docs?
replies.author: bradfordb-vmware

timeline.bodyText: should we do hive:orc:vectorized ? Or better yet give it as a user option VECTORIZE=true since other profiles might also want to support vectorized execution or we can even auto-apply it if necessary ?
timeline.author: denalex

replies.bodyText: the latter would require a code change, let's discuss further

timeline.message:
Hive profile names now split "protocol" and "format"

The hive profile names do not follow the "protocol":"format" naming
convention introduced for HCFS profiles. This commit adds Hive profile
names with the new format. For example, `HiveORC` becomes `hive:orc`.
